CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 3;No violation of Art. 14+3;Non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Khanlar Hajiyev;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in PERSON .

CARDINAL . On DATE a request that minor - offences proceedings be instituted against the applicant was lodged with ORG ( Prekršajni sud u ORG ) , following an allegation that on DATE the applicant ( then aged DATE ) and CARDINAL other individuals had physically attacked CARDINAL minors , GPE , GPE and GPE , by hitting them and kicking them all over their bodies while simultaneously shouting obscenities . They had also damaged a vehicle owned by the mother of CARDINAL of the victims and had broken CARDINAL of its front lights and the front bumper .

CARDINAL . On TIME DATE the above - mentioned PERSON ( born on CARDINAL DATE ) , GPE ( born on DATE ) and PERSON ( born on DATE ) , together with CARDINAL friends , PERSON ( born on DATE ) , ORG ( born on CARDINAL DATE ) , GPE ( born on DATE ) and PERSON ( born on CARDINAL DATE ) , approached the applicant , who was in the company of CARDINAL friends , and asked him about the incident of DATE . The applicant then verbally insulted PERSON on the basis of his NORP origin . A fight ensued .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE the police interviewed the individuals from the above group . Their statements concurred as to the fact that they had been friends with the applicant until the incident of CARDINAL DATE . On DATE they had agreed that they would find the applicant and attack him . When they attacked the applicant , he had pulled out a knife and stabbed GPE twice . PERSON had then hit the applicant on the head with a wooden plank and all of them , including the applicant , had left the scene .
CARDINAL . In his statement of DATE PERSON mentioned that the applicant was of GPE origin , but did not elaborate on this point . The relevant part of the statement reads :

“ As regards PERSON , he is of GPE origin . He used to mistreat the others on occasions when any of them was alone . He threatened to attack them , which caused fear in the group because they were afraid of him and of such behaviour . ”

CARDINAL . The police also interviewed the applicant and CARDINAL other neutral witnesses . In his statement the applicant gave no indication that any of the assailants had made reference to his GPE origin .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant , represented by legal counsel , lodged a criminal complaint with the NORP State Attorney ’s Office ( Općinsko državno odvjetništvo u GPE ) against CARDINAL identified individuals ( GPE , GPE , GPE , GPE , GPE and PERSON ) and a seventh unknown individual , alleging that on DATE they had approached and surrounded him and proceeded to hit him until he fell to the ground . They had then started to kick him . When the beating stopped he had stood up , whereupon PERSON had hit him on the head with a wooden plank , causing him to lose consciousness . The attack had caused him severe bodily injuries . Furthermore , on DATE the same men had told a certain GPE to tell the applicant that they were going to burn him alive . The applicant alleged that they had thus committed CARDINAL criminal offences , namely assault leading to grievous bodily harm and threatening behaviour , and asked for criminal proceedings to be brought against them .

CARDINAL . In a letter to ORG dated DATE the “ PERSON ” ORG in GPE , where the applicant had been examined , described the applicant ’s injuries as grievous . A letter of discharge dated CARDINAL DATE stated that the applicant had been admitted to the hospital on DATE and had been diagnosed with concussion and numerous contusions to the head and body .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG lodged a criminal complaint with the GPE State Attorney ’s ORG against GPE , alleging that at TIME on DATE he and his friends , PERSON , GPE , GPE , GPE and GPE , had had a fight with the applicant . The complaint alleged that they had planned the fight beforehand and for that purpose had gone to a location where they expected to find the applicant . After verbally assaulting him , they had beaten him up and kicked him all over his body . CARDINAL of them , PERSON , had hit him on the head with a wooden plank and the applicant had lost consciousness . The complaint also cited the above medical records stating that the applicant had sustained grievous bodily injuries .

CARDINAL . In submissions of DATE the applicant ’s counsel pointed out that she had lodged a criminal complaint on DATE and asked to be informed of the case - file number . She further contended that ORG and CARDINAL of the Convention and Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW for ORG required ORG authorities to take all steps to identify within a reasonable time the perpetrators of criminal offences against life and limb , and to do so with particular urgency where , as in the case at issue , the victim was a member of a national minority ( GPE ) . She added that all the circumstances indicated that the offence was racially motivated .

CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE State Attorney ’s ORG forwarded the applicant ’s criminal complaint to the Velika Gorica State Attorney ’s ORG . A medical report was prepared by a court expert in forensic medicine . As regards the injuries sustained by the applicant , the relevant part of the report reads :

“ Examination and treatment of the victim , PERSON , established numerous blows which caused contusions and lacerations to his head and body each of which amounts to a bodily injury ( under the previous classification , a lesser bodily injury ) . The injuries were caused by several blows from one or more hard objects , possibly a fist , a shoe - clad foot or a similar object . If some of the blows were struck by a shoe - clad foot , the victim was most probably bent over or lying on the ground . Since the injuries are not described in detail , it is not possible to establish their number or the number of blows . The blows were of minor to medium intensity .
The diagnosis of concussion , although mentioned , was not objectively established in the medical documentation enclosed in the file , and could therefore not be forensically accepted .
Taken together , all of the injuries sustained by the victim PERSON amount to a bodily injury . ”
As regards the injuries sustained by GPE , the relevant part of the report reads :

“ Examination of GPE revealed CARDINAL stab wounds on his back . Since these wounds are not described in detail , only an indirect conclusion can be reached , namely that , given the lack of injuries in deeper structures , the wounds were shallow and each of them , taken separately and together , amounted to bodily injury . The injuries were caused by CARDINAL separate knife stabs or stab blows by a similar object . The stabs were of minor intensity . At the moment of stabbing the victim most probably had his back turned towards the assailant . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the Velika Gorica ORG Attorney ’s ORG decided not to institute criminal proceedings against PERSON on the ground that the medical analysis of the injuries sustained by the applicant indicated that the diagnosis of concussion could not be accepted forensically , given that all the other injuries were of a lesser nature . Under the relevant domestic law a prosecution for such injuries had to be brought privately by the victim , while a prosecution for grievous bodily injuries had to be initiated by the relevant ORG authorities . The applicant was thus instructed to proceed accordingly and to ask , within DATE , that a juvenile panel from a competent county court institute criminal proceedings against GPE

CARDINAL . In her submissions of DATE to the Velika Gorica ORG Attorney ’s ORG , the applicant ’s counsel asked for the criminal complaint of DATE against the other suspects to be treated as a private prosecution for the offence under LAW of assault occasioning bodily harm .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s counsel brought a private prosecution against PERSON , then a minor , in ORG of ORG for the offence under LAW . On DATE ORG ordered the applicant ’s counsel to inform it of the date of birth of PERSON and to proceed in accordance with sections DATE , CARDINAL and CARDINAL of FAC .

CARDINAL . In her submissions to the Velika Gorica State Attorney ’s ORG of DATE , the applicant ’s counsel argued that the decision of DATE not to prosecute concerned only the criminal complaint lodged by the police on DATE , but not the criminal complaint lodged by the applicant on DATE , since the latter was broader in scope than the police complaint . She further emphasised that the offence against the applicant was racially motivated and asked the ORG to act with reasonable expedition . She also argued that the failure to act by the ORG Attorney ’s ORG had infringed the applicant ’s constitutional rights to equality and to life , and his rights not to be ill - treated , to have a competent court decide his rights and obligations , to respect for his private and family life and honour , and to protection from violence and hatred based on his nationality , race or religion . She also relied on LAW on LAW in GPE , LAW , LAW and LAW .

CARDINAL . In her submission to ORG of DATE the applicant ’s counsel stated that she was not in a position to find out PERSON ’s date of birth and that such information had to be requested from ORG . She also submitted that the order to proceed in accordance with sections CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL of ORG had been unclear . She further argued that the applicant had been prevented from prosecuting his assailants and that it was the practice of ORG not to prosecute acts of violence against citizens of GPE origin . She repeated the contentions she had made to the Velika Gorica State Attorney concerning the infringement of the applicant ’s rights .

CARDINAL . In a letter of DATE , ORG invited the applicant ’s counsel to explain whether the private prosecution of PERSON was to be considered as an application to the juvenile panel of a competent county court under section CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW . In her reply of DATE , the applicant ’s counsel confirmed that this was the case . She further explained that on DATE the Velika Gorica ORG Attorney ’s ORG had given her an erroneous instruction to bring a private prosecution against PERSON since , under LAW , the prosecution of a minor could not be brought privately , but only by a competent ORG . She further pointed out that she had consulted the case file and that no expert assessment had been conducted of the injuries sustained by the applicant , contrary to the statement by the ORG Attorney ’s ORG in its decision not to prosecute of DATE . She also argued that the offence in question had infringed the applicant ’s right to life and personal safety , and the prohibition of torture , inhuman and degrading treatment , and that he had had no effective remedy for the protection of those rights .

CARDINAL . NORP In a letter of DATE addressed to the Velika Gorica State Attorney ’s ORG , the GPE State Attorney ’s Office expressed its view that the former body ’s decision not to prosecute PERSON had been erroneous and contrary to LAW , which required the competent ORG to undertake an official prosecution against minors even in respect of criminal offences otherwise subject to private prosecution . The GPE State Attorney ’s Office indicated that it was necessary to obtain information about PERSON from a competent ORG and then to declare the criminal complaint against PERSON inadmissible , in accordance with LAW , subject to the condition that PERSON be ordered to undertake CARDINAL of the measures listed in that provision .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG decided to bring charges of bodily injury under LAW against PERSON before a juvenile judge . The case file was forwarded to ORG in order for it to conduct the proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Velika Gorica ORG Attorney ’s ORG lodged a request with the juvenile judge of ORG for preparatory proceedings to be instituted against PERSON They asked that PERSON and other participants be interviewed regarding the circumstances of the offence in question . They further requested a fresh report from ORG , in order to decide whether there was a need for an educative measure in respect of PERSON

CARDINAL . The hearing before ORG , scheduled for DATE , was adjourned because counsel for the defendant failed to appear . At the hearing held on DATE the applicant gave his evidence . He did not indicate in any way that any of the assailants had made reference to his GPE origin . He stated that on DATE he had been in the company of CARDINAL of his friends when the assailants approached him and then attacked him . None of his friends had been involved in the incident .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG submitted their report on PERSON , drawn up on DATE . The relevant part of the report reads :
“ ... He completed vocational school ... acquiring a qualification as a machine technician . He was temporarily employed ... until he was conscripted to military service in DATE .
He completed his military service in DATE . Since then he has been unemployed but is registered with ORG .
... there is no evidence that he has committed any further criminal offences .
His cooperation and communication are adequate . He is polite and comes across as a serious young man .

In view of his personality , the conditions of his upbringing and his current life , we consider that the criminal offence he has been charged with was a misdemeanour attributable to his youth and the consequence of a stressful situation .

In view of the fact that this was the first time he had ever been reported as a criminal offender and that , in the meantime , he has committed no further criminal offences , we consider it justifiable to impose an educative measure in the form of a special obligation requiring him to participate in the activities of humanitarian organisations or activities of ecological or communal interest . ”

CARDINAL . A qualified social worker conducted a further interview with PERSON on DATE for the purposes of the criminal proceedings against him . The relevant part of the report on the interview reads :
“ ... To date there has been no need for social services intervention in the family , including in respect of B. , who has no record of crime or misdemeanours .
He takes seriously the fact that he has been the subject of proceedings before a court of law , as does his mother , and he expresses concern about the outcome .

The above observations lead to the conclusion that PERSON ’s general functioning is adequate , being marked by pronounced social and emotional maturity and clear and mature opinions . He shows a responsible attitude towards his obligations .

Therefore , should his criminal responsibility be established , the offence could be construed as a misdemeanour arising out of a specific situation , and the imposition of an educative measure in the form of a special obligation to participate in humanitarian activities seems justified . ”

CARDINAL . At the hearing held on CARDINAL DATE TIME , GPE , GPE , GPE and ORG gave evidence as witnesses . None of them made any reference to the applicant ’s GPE origin . They all stated that they had socialised with the applicant and belonged to the same circle of friends prior to the incident of DATE . In a decision of CARDINAL DATE ORG instituted preparatory proceedings against PERSON , under section PERSON ) of LAW . A hearing scheduled for DATE was adjourned on the ground that PERSON , who was studying in GPE and had been called as a witness , did not appear . He gave his evidence at the hearing held on DATE . On DATE the applicant ’s counsel submitted an application to expedite the proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Velika Gorica State Attorney ’s ORG made a proposal that PERSON , under sections DATE and CARDINAL of LAW , take part in the work of humanitarian organisations or activities of communal or ecological interest instead of having criminal sanctions imposed on him . The proposal was based on the family and personal circumstances of PERSON , who had meanwhile become an adult , had successfully completed his schooling and military service and was looking for a job . There had been no further criminal complaints against him .

CARDINAL . On DATE and CARDINAL May CARDINAL the applicant ’s counsel submitted further applications to expedite the proceedings . On DATE ORG joined the CARDINAL sets of proceedings . On DATE the applicant ’s counsel submitted a further application to expedite the proceedings . On DATE the applicant ’s counsel submitted a fresh application to expedite the proceedings to the President of ORG , stressing that the prosecution was about to become time - barred .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG discontinued the proceedings against PERSON on the ground that the prosecution for the offence with which he was charged had become time - barred on DATE . A subsequent appeal by the applicant was dismissed on DATE by ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Velika Gorica State Attorney ’s Office declared the applicant ’s criminal complaint of DATE inadmissible in respect of GPE , GPE , GPE and GPE as , under the relevant domestic law , a prosecution for bodily harm had to be brought privately by the victim . As to the alleged threat , PERSON , in a statement to ORG , denied telling the applicant that any such threat had been made . The applicant was informed of his right to take over the prosecution as a subsidiary prosecutor and to lodge a private subsidiary indictment with ORG or to request an investigation through ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant , represented by counsel , lodged a private subsidiary indictment against CARDINAL suspects ( all of the assailants but PERSON and the CARDINAL unidentified assailant ) with ORG for the offences set out in LAW and CARDINAL of LAW , namely causing bodily harm and causing grievous bodily harm . He also asked for these proceedings to be joined with those already pending before the same court against GPE
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG asked ORG to prepare reports on the defendants .
CARDINAL . The relevant part of the report on ORG , drawn up on DATE , reads :
“ ... he dropped out of high school and in DATE enrolled in a training course for security guards ... which he plans to complete by DATE .
He has less time for leisure because he is attending classes and assisting in renovation work on the family home .
S. greets others and communicates with them politely .
His hygiene habits are appropriate to his age .
He smokes and drinks alcoholic drinks occasionally .

In a decision of the [ Velika Gorica Municipal ] Court ... of DATE an educative measure was imposed on him in the form of close care and supervision and a special obligation to undergo specialised medical treatment or treatment for drug and other addictions .
S. carried out the above special obligation in GPE for ORG , although there were difficulties in respect of his frequency of ... attendance .
The educative measure consisting of close care and supervision was implemented , although there were difficulties related to regular communication and performance of the programme tasks .
S. lives with his parents and brother PERSON

The parents cared for the children ’s basic needs according to their abilities . However , they lacked the capacity to face up to the developmental difficulties [ of children ] . Becoming aware of their helplessness in bringing up their children and their lack of authority , they became discouraged .
The family live in their own house ... where they moved DATE after living in a flat ...
S. has not adapted well to rural life .
As regards the question of criminal proceedings , we propose that a special obligation be imposed in the form of participation in humanitarian activities . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant part of the report on ORG , drawn up on DATE , reads :

“ ... In DATE , as the driver of a vehicle , [ he had ] a road accident in which he sustained multiple contusions to his head and lungs . He was hospitalised ... He was unconscious for DATE . ... As a consequence ... he had a mild motor skills and speech disorder and frequent headaches . ... His current health is good .
He completed high school ... and obtained a qualification as a waiter ... he then also completed training as a lorry driver and a driver of vehicles for the transport of dangerous materials .
For a period of time he worked as a waiter and in DATE he has worked as a driver .
He did not perform military service . He lives with his parents and is not married .
He cooperates well and communicates adequately .

The records of this centre show that in DATE preliminary proceedings were conducted against the then minor PERSON in ORG in connection with the criminal offence of causing a road accident . The proceedings were terminated [ without a conviction ] since the court applied the principle of appropriateness [ of criminal punishment ] .
He has not committed any further criminal offences .

On the basis of the above we consider , should his criminal responsibility be established , that application of LAW is justified , and we propose that a special obligation be imposed in the form of participation in the activities of humanitarian organisations or activities of ecological or communal interest . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant part of the report on PERSON , drawn up on DATE , reads :

“ We have not been able to contact the above - mentioned young adult directly . Instead , we conducted a telephone conversation with NORP , who indicated that he is currently resident in GPE with his mother and studying computer science .
The records of this ORG show that NORP has not committed any further criminal offence nor is there any record of any other asocial behaviour .

On the basis of the above we consider , should his criminal responsibility be established , that application of LAW is justified , and we propose that a special obligation be imposed in the form of participation in the activities of humanitarian organisations or activities of ecological or communal interest . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant part of the report on GPE , drawn up on DATE , reads :
“ ... he dropped out of a [ vocational ] high school he had attended until the third grade .

In DATE he completed his military service , and after returning to his family decided to continue his education and enrolled in TIME classes in the same [ vocational ] school , in order to obtain a qualification in electronics .
Currently he is about to complete his education , and needs only to pass the final exams . Meanwhile , PERSON has been working part - time and since DATE has been employed in ORG ...
He is unmarried and lives with his parents .
According to the records of this ORG he has not committed any further criminal offences .
He cooperates well and communicates adequately . He comes across as a serious young man .

On the basis of the above , we consider , should his criminal responsibility be established , that application of LAW is justified , and we propose that a special obligation be imposed in the form of participation in the activities of humanitarian organisations or activities of ecological or communal interest . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant part of the report on GPE , drawn up on DATE , reads :
“ ... he completed vocational school on schedule and graduated in DATE .
After graduation he was unemployed since he could not find a job , but he helped his parents [ on their ] agricultural [ land ] .
In DATE he completed his military service .
Currently , he is employed in a construction firm ...
He states that , owning to his work , he does not have much leisure time , which he then spends resting or helping his parents .
According to the information of this ORG he has not committed any further criminal offences in the meantime .
He cooperates well and comes across as a serious young man .

On the basis of the above , we consider , should his criminal responsibility be established , that application of LAW is justified , and we propose that a special obligation be imposed in the form of participation in the activities of humanitarian organisations or activities of ecological or communal interest . ”

CARDINAL . The first hearing , scheduled for DATE , was adjourned since CARDINAL of the CARDINAL defendants appeared . On DATE and CARDINAL May CARDINAL the applicant ’s counsel submitted further applications to expedite the proceedings .

CARDINAL . NORP On DATE ORG joined the CARDINAL sets of proceedings . At a hearing on DATE the presiding judge served a copy of the applicant ’s subsidiary private indictment on the defendants and scheduled the next hearing for DATE . On DATE ORG severed the proceedings . On CARDINAL DATE ORG discontinued the proceedings against the remaining defendants , on the ground that the prosecution of the offences with which they were charged had become time - barred on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant , represented by legal counsel , brought a civil action against CARDINAL defendants ( the CARDINAL identified perpetrators of the acts of violence against the applicant and the parents of CARDINAL of the assailants who had been minors at the time of the attack ) in ORG ( PERSON ) , seeking damages for the injuries he had sustained .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s counsel submitted an application to expedite the proceedings . At a hearing on DATE ORG decided to stay the proceedings pending the outcome of the criminal proceedings against the defendants .

CARDINAL . In submissions of DATE , the applicant ’s counsel complained that the above decision had not been served on her and asked for it to be set aside since the conduct of the criminal proceedings had been ineffective . On DATE her submissions were returned to her . When she enquired about the case she was told that on DATE it had been transferred to ORG ( PERSON ) . However , when on DATE and DATE she made enquiries about the case at the latter court she received no reply .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s counsel lodged a complaint about the length of the civil proceedings with ORG . This complaint was upheld on DATE ; ORG awarded the applicant MONEY ( HRK ) in compensation and ordered ORG to adopt a decision within DATE .
CARDINAL . At the hearing held on DATE ORG ordered that a medical report be drawn up . On DATE the experts submitted their report of DATE . The relevant part of the report reads :

“ The plaintiff received initial medical assistance in the surgical department of the ‘ PERSON Duh’ ORG in GPE on DATE . He received treatment and was discharged from hospital on DATE , following an improvement [ in his condition ] . [ He was ] advised to rest and take painkillers and to [ return for ] a neurological check - up in DATE , with the results of an EEG examination .
When examined by the experts the plaintiff complained of continuing headaches .
A clinical examination did not reveal pathological substrates .
The medical documentation consists of a discharge letter , without any further check - ups .
OPINION : The medical documentation and the patient ’s condition can be linked to the harmful act in question and the injuries sustained by the plaintiff on that occasion .
Pain of significant intensity lasted DATE , of medium intensity DATE and of minor intensity DATE .
The remaining minor , occasional pains are caused by increased physical effort .

The initial fear was intense and short in duration . Secondary fear ( in respect of the injuries and their consequences ) of significant intensity lasted DATE , of medium intensity DATE and of minor intensity a week .
The medical documentation and examination of the victim did not reveal any lasting consequences from the harmful act .
The plaintiff did not require assistance from other persons . ”
The civil proceedings before ORG are still pending .
CARDINAL . The relevant parts of LAW ( PERSON , ORG no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) provide :
“ ( CARDINAL ) Criminal proceedings in respect of criminal offences shall be instituted by ORG in the interest of GPE and its citizens .

( CARDINAL ) In exceptional circumstances the law may provide for criminal proceedings in respect of certain criminal offences to be instituted on the basis of a private prosecution or for ORG to institute criminal proceedings following [ a private ] application . ”
“ Anyone who inflicts bodily injury on another or impairs another ’s health shall be fined or sentenced to imprisonment for a term not exceeding DATE . ”
“ Criminal proceedings for the offence of inflicting bodily injury ( LAW ) shall be instituted by means of a private prosecution . ”

“ A public official , or another person acting at the instigation or with the explicit or tacit acquiescence of a public official , who inflicts on another person pain or grave suffering , whether physical or mental , for such purposes as obtaining from him or a third person information or a confession , punishing him for an act he or a third person has committed or is suspected of having committed , or intimidating or coercing him or a third person , or for any reason based on discrimination of any kind , shall be sentenced to imprisonment for a term of DATE . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW ( Zakon o kaznenom postupku , ORG nos . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , DATE , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) provide :
“ ( CARDINAL ) Criminal proceedings shall be instituted and conducted at the request of a qualified prosecutor only . ...

( CARDINAL ) In respect of criminal offences subject to public prosecution the qualified prosecutor shall be the ORG Attorney and in respect of criminal offences to be prosecuted privately the qualified prosecutor shall be a private prosecutor .

( CARDINAL ) Unless otherwise provided by law , the ORG Attorney shall undertake a criminal prosecution where there is a reasonable suspicion that an identified person has committed a criminal offence subject to public prosecution and where there are no legal impediments to the prosecution of that person .

( CARDINAL ) Where the ORG Attorney finds that there are no grounds to institute or conduct criminal proceedings , the injured party as a subsidiary prosecutor may take his place under the conditions prescribed by this LAW . ”

Articles CARDINAL to CARDINAL regulate the rights and duties of private prosecutors and of injured parties acting as subsidiary prosecutors . The Criminal Code distinguishes between these CARDINAL roles . A private prosecutor ( privatni tužitelj ) is an injured party who brings a private prosecution in respect of criminal offences for which such prosecution is expressly prescribed by LAW ( these are offences of a lesser degree ) . The injured party as a subsidiary prosecutor ( oštećeni kao tužitelj ) takes over criminal proceedings in respect of criminal offences subject to public prosecution where the relevant prosecuting authorities , for whatever reason , have decided not to prosecute . Pursuant to LAW , where the prosecution is brought privately , the charge must be lodged with the relevant authority within DATE after the qualified prosecutor has learnt of the offence and the identity of the perpetrator .
“ ( CARDINAL ) A request to prosecute shall be lodged with the competent ORG Attorney ’s ORG and a private prosecution with the competent court .
( CARDINAL ) Where the injured party has lodged a criminal complaint ... he or she shall be considered to have thereby lodged a request to prosecute .

( CARDINAL ) Where the injured party has lodged a criminal complaint or a request to prosecute but the [ competent authorities ] establish that the criminal offence in question should be prosecuted on the basis of a private prosecution , the criminal complaint or the request to prosecute shall be treated as a timely private prosecution if it has been submitted within the time - limit prescribed for [ bringing ] a private prosecution ... ”

Pursuant to LAW , the ORG Attorney is under a duty to inform the injured party within DATE of a decision not to prosecute and of that party ’s right to take over the proceedings , as well as to instruct that party on the steps to be taken .
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW ( Zakon o sudovima za mladež , ORG nos . CARDINAL , CARDINAL/CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) read as follows :
“ A minor is a person who , at the time of the offence , was CARDINAL but not older than DATE . A young adult is a person who , at the time of the offence , was CARDINAL but not older CARDINAL . ”
“ ( CARDINAL ) Sanctions in respect of minors who have committed criminal offences are educative measures , imprisonment of a minor and security measures .
“ ( CARDINAL ) Educative measures are :
( CARDINAL ) special obligations

“ ( CARDINAL ) A court may order a minor to fulfil CARDINAL or more special obligations where it finds that appropriate orders or injunctions are needed to influence the minor and his or her conduct .
( CARDINAL ) A court may impose the following obligations :
CARDINAL . to participate in the activities of humanitarian organisations or activities of communal or ecological interest .

( CARDINAL ) In connection with the obligation under paragraph CARDINAL , point CARDINAL of this section a court may impose a maximum of CARDINAL TIME within DATE , so as not to hinder the minor ’s education or regular employment ;
( CARDINAL) A competent ORG shall supervise the enforcement of the obligation ... ”
“ ( CARDINAL ) Criminal proceedings against minors shall be instituted at the request of the ORG Attorney in respect of all criminal offences .

( CARDINAL ) Prosecution [ of minors ] in respect of criminal offences generally subject to private prosecution may be instituted if a person authorised [ to initiate a private prosecution ] has lodged an application for proceedings to be instituted with the competent ORG Attorney ’s ORG within DATE of learning of the offence and the identity of the perpetrator . ”
“ In criminal proceedings against a minor [ the ] victim can not take the role of prosecutor . ”

“ ( CARDINAL ) Where the ORG Attorney has decided under LAW of this LAW that there is no ground to request that criminal proceedings be instituted against a minor ( LAW ) , he or she shall notify the victim of this and state the reasons for his or her decision ...

( CARDINAL ) Within DATE after notification [ under paragraph CARDINAL ] has been served on the victim , he or she may request a competent juvenile council of a higher court to decide whether proceedings should be instituted . The division shall decide after it has obtained the opinion of the ORG Attorney . The division may decide that the proceedings should not be instituted at all or that they should be instituted before a juvenile judge .
( CARDINAL ) Where the division has decided that proceedings should be instituted , the competent ORG Attorney ’s ORG shall take over the proceedings against a minor . ”

“ ( CARDINAL ) In respect of criminal offences which carry a sentence of imprisonment not exceeding DATE or a fine , the ORG Attorney may decide not to request that criminal proceedings be instituted , despite the existence of a reasonable suspicion that a minor has committed such an offence , where the ORG Attorney considers that the proceedings against the minor would not fulfil any purpose in view of the nature of the offence and the circumstances under which it was committed , as well as the previous life and personality of the minor in question . In order to establish these facts , the ORG Attorney may request information from the [ minor ’s ] parents ... other persons and institutions ... or interview the minor in question ...

( CARDINAL ) The ORG Attorney shall inform the competent ORG and the victim about his or her decision under paragraph CARDINAL of this section and shall inform the latter of his or her right to bring any compensatory claim he or she might have in civil proceedings ... ”
“ ( CARDINAL ) The ORG Attorney may make his or her decision not to institute proceedings ( section CARDINAL ) subject to the minor ’s willingness to :
( b ) participate in the activities of humanitarian organisations or activities of communal or ecological interest ( within the limits of section CARDINAL(CARDINAL).CARDINAL ) .
“ ( CARDINAL ) A request that preparatory proceedings be instituted shall be lodged with a competent juvenile judge by the ORG Attorney .
( CARDINAL ) Where the juvenile judge agrees with the request she or he shall issue a decision that preparatory proceedings are to be instituted . ... ”
CARDINAL . The relevant part of the Rules on the ORG Attorney ’s Offices ( PERSON o unutarnjem poslovanju u državnim odvjetništvima , ORG no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) reads :

“ A victim , a party represented by a ORG Attorney ’s Office ... or an interested person , other than a suspect , an accused or an opposing party in the proceedings , may consult a criminal , civil or other case file held by the ORG Attorney . Such persons may also be allowed to copy the case file in whole or in part .
Permission to consult or copy the case file shall be given by the ORG Attorney or the official in charge of a particular case file . ”
